TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"> <div id="FTR"> <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"> </div> </div> <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always"> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"> </div> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"> <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2"> </div> </div> <div id="HDR"> <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"> </div> </div> </div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -82.8pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.</font></div> <div> <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%"> <tr valign="top"> <td style="WIDTH: 5px"> <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </td> <td width="976"> <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTES CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div> </td> </tr> </table> </div> <div> <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%"> <tr valign="top"> <td style="WIDTH: 540pt"> <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: none">&#160;<font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline">(Unaudited)</font></font></font></div> </td> <td>&#160;</td> </tr> </table> </div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In quarter, Company raised approximately $500 million loan secured aircraft.&#160;&#160;The loan bears interest LIBOR-based (London Interbank Offered Rate) variable rate fixed margin resets quarterly due installments 2015.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div> <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%"> <tr valign="top"> <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 27pt"> <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">7.&#160;&#160;</font></div> </td> <td> <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In September 2006, Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued Statement Financial Accounting Standards No. 157 &#8220;Fair Value Measurements&#8221; (SFAS 157).&#160;&#160;SFAS 157 introduces framework measuring fair expands required disclosure fair measurements assets liabilities.&#160;&#160;SFAS 157 financial assets liabilities effective fiscal years beginning November 15, 2007, Company adopted standard assets liabilities January 1, 2008 impact adoption significant.</font></div> </td> </tr> </table> </div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">SFAS 157 defines fair exchange price received asset paid transfer liability (an exit price) principal advantageous market asset liability orderly transaction market participants measurement date. SFAS 157 establishes fair hierarchy requires entity maximize observable inputs minimize unobservable inputs measuring fair value. The standard describes levels inputs measure fair value:</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Level 1</font> - Quoted prices active markets identical assets liabilities.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Level 2</font> - Observable inputs Level 1 prices quoted prices similar assets liabilities; quoted prices markets active; inputs observable corroborated observable market data substantially full term assets liabilities.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s short-term investments primarily utilize broker quotes non-active market valuation securities.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s fuel derivative contracts, primarily consist commodity options collars, valued energy commodity market data derived combining raw inputs quantitative models processes generate forward curves volatilities.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Level 3</font> - Unobservable inputs supported market activity significant fair assets liabilities.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Company utilizes market approach measure fair financial assets liabilities.&#160;&#160;The market approach prices relevant information generated market transactions involving identical comparable assets liabilities.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PART II:&#160;&#160;OTHER INFORMATION</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Item 1</font>.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Legal Proceedings</font></font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Between April 3, 2003 June 5, 2003, lawsuits filed travel agents, opted prior class action (now dismissed) pursue claims individually American, airline defendants, case airline defendants Orbitz LLC.&#160; The cases, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Tam Travel et. al., v. Delta Air Lines et. al</font>., United States District Court Northern District California, San Francisco (51 individual agencies), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Paula Fausky d/b/a Timeless Travel v. American Airlines, et. al, </font>in United States District Court Northern District Ohio, Eastern Division (29 agencies) <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Swope Travel al. v. Orbitz et. al</font>. United States District Court Eastern District Texas, Beaumont Division (71 agencies) consolidated pre-trial purposes United States District Court Northern District Ohio, Eastern Division.&#160; Collectively, lawsuits seek damages injunctive relief alleging airline defendants Orbitz LLC: (i) conspired prevent travel agents acting effective competitors distribution airline tickets passengers violation Section 1 Sherman Act;&#160; (ii) conspired monopolize distribution common carrier air travel airports United States violation Section 2 Sherman Act; (iii) 1995 present, airline defendants conspired reduce commissions paid U.S.-based travel agents violation Section 1 Sherman Act.&#160; On September 23, 2005, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Fausky</font> plaintiffs dismissed claims prejudice. &#160;On September 14, 2006, court dismissed prejudice 28 <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Swope</font> plaintiffs.&#160;&#160;On October 29, 2007, court dismissed actions.&#160;&#160;The <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Tam</font> plaintiffs appealed court&#8217;s decision.&#160;&#160;The <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Swope</font> plaintiffs moved case remanded Eastern District Texas. &#160;American continues vigorously defend lawsuits.&#160; A final adverse court decision awarding substantial money damages placing material restrictions Company&#8217;s distribution practices material adverse impact Company.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On July 12, 2004, consolidated class action complaint subsequently amended November 30, 2004, filed American Association Professional Flight Attendants (APFA), union represents American&#8217;s flight attendants (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Ann M. Marcoux, al., v. American Airlines Inc., al.</font> United States District Court Eastern District New York). While class certified, lawsuit seeks behalf American&#8217;s flight attendants subclasses set aside, obtain damages allegedly resulting from, April 2003 Collective Bargaining Agreement referred Restructuring Participation Agreement (RPA). The RPA labor agreements American successfully reached unions order avoid filing bankruptcy 2003.&#160;&#160;In related case <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">(Sherry Cooper, al. v. TWA Airlines, LLC, al.</font>, United States District Court Eastern District New York), court denied preliminary injunction implementation RPA June 30, 2003. The <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Marcoux</font> suit alleges claims APFA American relating RPA ratification vote RPA individual APFA members, including: violation Labor Management Reporting Disclosure Act (LMRDA) APFA&#8217;s Constitution By-laws, violation APFA duty fair representation members, violation American provisions Railway Labor Act (RLA) improper coercion flight attendants voting changing vote ratification, violations Racketeer Influenced Corrupt Organizations<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Act 1970 (RICO). On March 28, 2006, district court dismissed state law claims American, LMRDA claims APFA, claimed violations RICO.&#160;&#160;On July 22, 2008, district court granted summary judgment American APFA remaining claimed violations RLA duty fair representation American APFA (as LMRDA claim claim APFA breach constitution).&#160;&#160;On August 20, 2008, notice appeal filed behalf purported class flight attendants. Although Company believes case merit American APFA vigorously defending lawsuit, final adverse court decision invalidating RPA awarding substantial money damages material adverse impact Company.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br> <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"> <div id="FTR"> <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">--</font></div> </div> <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </div> <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always"> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"> <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2"> </div> </div> <div id="HDR"> <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </div> </div><br> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On February 14, 2006, Antitrust Division United States Department Justice (the &#8220;DOJ&#8221;) served Company grand jury subpoena part ongoing investigation criminal violations antitrust laws domestic foreign air cargo carriers. If U.S. government extend policy December&#160;31, 2008, U.S. government time ceases provide insurance, reduces coverage provided insurance, attempt purchase similar coverage narrower scope commercial insurers additional cost. To extent coverage commercially reasonable rates, adversely affected.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">While price commercial insurance declined period immediately Terrorist Attacks, event commercial insurance carriers reduce amount insurance coverage us, significantly increase cost, adversely affected.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">We unable retain key management personnel.</font></font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Since Terrorist Attacks, number key management employees elected retire early leave financially favorable opportunities companies, airline industry. There assurance retain key management employees. Any inability retain key management employees, attract retain additional qualified management employees, negative impact us.</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br> <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"> <div id="FTR"> <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">--</font></div> </div> <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </div> <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always"> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"> <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2"> </div> </div> <div id="HDR"> <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div> </div> </div><br> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">We adversely affected failure disruption computer, communications technology systems.</font></font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We heavily increasingly dependent technology operate business. TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 100.8pt"></font>1.1.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Provide Customer's IFE/CCS system requirements Boeing;</font></div> <div style="DISPLAY: block;
